title: Cajun Sole With Green Beans & Cauliflower
summary: Cajun Sole With Green Beans & Cauliflower is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 1. One portion of this dish contains about 182g of protein, 40g of fat, and a total of 1253 calories. For $30.42 per serving, this recipe covers 72% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 40 minutes. A mixture of butter, style beans, lemon juice, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is a pricey recipe for fans of Creole food. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 78%. This score is solid. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Cajun Sole With Green Beans & Cauliflower, Cajun Quinoa, Baked Salmon and Summer Green Beans, and Garlicky Potatoes, Green Beans and Cauliflower.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: preheat your oven to 350 degrees.spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.lay your fillets evenly spaced on the sheet.evenly & gently pour the lemon juice over each fillet- creating a moist side.sprinkle cajun seasoning over each fillet coating well - almost giving the image of blackened sole.bake for 30 minutes (max) -VEGETABLES -Microwave your cauliflour until cooked but still a little crunchy (approx. 8 - 10 mins).finely cut up your green onion and toss into the bean bowl.microwave your frozen french cut green beans & onion until done (approx 8 mins).Drain any liquid from the vegetables and toss together with the butter, salt and pepper totaste.Serve while still hot and fish is fresh from the oven. These two dishes take approximately the same time to cook / prepare and cook so there is no wait time between dishes.Enjoy Bon Appetite !

steps.step: preheat your oven to 350 degrees.spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.lay your fillets evenly spaced on the sheet.evenly & gently pour the lemon juice over each fillet- creating a moist side.sprinkle cajun seasoning over each fillet coating well - almost giving the image of blackened sole.bake for 30 minutes (max) -VEGETABLES -Microwave your cauliflour until cooked but still a little crunchy (approx. 8 - 10 mins).finely cut up your green onion and toss into the bean bowl.microwave your frozen french cut green beans & onion until done (approx 8 mins).
Drain any liquid from the vegetables and toss together with the butter, salt and pepper totaste.
Serve while still hot and fish is fresh from the oven. These two dishes take approximately the same time to cook / prepare and cook so there is no wait time between dishes.Enjoy Bon Appetite !
